kilijjati：[＜klid] 熱惱，（針紮似地）陣陣劇痛．pp．kilinna．

Kilijjati，[med-pass．of kilid=Sk．klid，to be wet．prob．= śliṣ to stick to，and confounded with svid，cp．also kelana & khela．The meaning “to get wet，to be soiled” only in pp．kilinna．-- The Dhtm （199），however，expls k．by parideva lament，to be in trouble，which is not quite in harmony with the meaning； it is more likely that in P．we have a confusion between klid & kliś in a meaning which differs from Sk．] to become heated，to get into a state of inflammation，to fester （of wounds） Vin．I，205 （vaṇo kilijjittha festered）； Sn．671 （gloss for kilissati，expld at SnA 481 by pūti hoti）．-- pp．kilinna．See also ukkiledeti （to clean out a stain，to “disinfect”）．（Page 216）

kilijjati：ကိလိဇ္ဇတိ （√ကိလိဒ်）
စိုစွတ်၏။ အနာပြည်တည်၏။
